examples.text: One hundred (of the children) have already been placed with foster families.
There were just a hundred of them there.
This vase is worth several hundred dollars.
She must be over a hundred *(= a hundred years old)*.
Hundreds of thousands of people are at risk.
If I've said it once, I've said it a hundred times.
I have **a hundred and one** things to do.
We're talking about a figure in the low hundreds.

definitions.definition: the years of a particular century
used to express whole hours in the 24-hour system
definitions.sensetop: one, two, three, etc. hundred hours

definitions.definition: to put as much effort into something as you can; to give even more effort than could be expected

examples.text: Every player gave a hundred per cent tonight.
I'm not a hundred per cent sure.
My family supports me one hundred per cent.
I still don't feel a hundred per cent.

wordOrigin: late Old English, from hund ‘hundred’ (from an Indo-European root shared with Latin centum and Greek hekaton) + a second element meaning ‘number’; of Germanic origin and related to Dutch honderd and German hundert.
